page.title: 01Rawcliffe and District
page.content: Our project area is on the north-west outskirts of York and covers the village of Rawcliffe (pop.3280) and parts of Clifton (pop.2895) and Nether Poppleton (pop. 1570). The River Ouse runs through and separates the three villages. Clifton was once Clyftone because of the cliff by the river leading to the low flat land called the Ings which is often flooded in Winter and Spring. The last fifty years have seen Rawcliffe develop from a quiet rural area to a rapidly expanding residential area.Now the 2nd world war airfield has housing and industrial development. The main employers in the village are Clifton Hospital and Armstrong's Engineering. Nether Poppleton is a quiet farming and residential community on the west bank of the River Ouse.
